column4: is there anycommand that tells me weather or not a PATA drive is working a a ceratin DMA mode?
is there any command that tells in which DMA a PATA drive is working?
is there any command that tells in which DMA mode a PATA drive is working?
the help menu options jsut came up, nothing else...
it says: IO_support    =  0 (default)  readonly      =  0 (off) readahead     = 256 (on) geometry      = 19457/255/63, sectors = 312581808, start = 0
the drive is not mounted yet, do you think that will be the problem?
No. More likely it's due to scsi layer. Probably need sdparm
ok, thanks, first time I see this command!
I run sdparm, but i can't decipher what the numbers mean
would DMA mode considered a caching mode?
the numbers are exit codes for othe scripts
Been a while since I used hdparm/sdparm, it may not be giving the info like bus speed you wanted to find out
will have to try something else then
